perturbation.original_text:
MMI warrants providing the Services with due diligence and care in accordance



with the specifications set by Dragon Systems. Should MMI not supply the Services as agreed or should the Services become defective within 6 months from their delivery to Dragon Systems, Dragon Systems may at its option require MMI to complete or re-perform the Services within a reasonable period of time, rescind the contract or refuse payment of the compensation in part or in total, notwithstanding any damage claims.
perturbation.changed_text:
MMI warrants providing the Services with due diligence and care in accordance



with the specifications set by Dragon Systems. Should MMI not supply the Services as agreed or should the Services become defective within 6 months from their delivery to Dragon Systems, Dragon Systems may at its option require MMI to request re-performing the services and if MMI cannot or will not re-perform, Dragon Systems must accept the original services without compensation or claims. Dragon Systems will be required to make payment in full regardless of damages.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause gives Dragon Systems several options if the services are not performed as agreed including refusal of payment. The new clause forces Dragon Systems to accept the original services and pay regardless, even if defective, directly contradicting the earlier options and warranty provided.

perturbation.original_text: Dragon Systems shall be entitled to deduct from or set off against any sums which Dragon Systems may be liable to pay to MMI any amounts owed by MMI, its affiliated entities, subsidiaries or successors in interest.
perturbation.changed_text: Dragon Systems shall not be entitled to deduct from or set off against any sums which Dragon Systems may be liable to pay to MMI any amounts owed by MMI, its affiliated entities, subsidiaries or successors in interest.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause gives Dragon Systems the right to deduct any amounts owed by MMI. The modified version removes this right entirely, creating a direct contradiction and uncertainty about payment terms.

perturbation.original_text:
This Agreement shall be valid for an indefinite period.

Both parties may terminate the Agreement with immediate effect

- -        of either party breaches a material term of the Agreement

- -        in case of a merger or change of key management or control

- -        in case of bankruptcy or similar.

Dragon may terminate this agreement without cause by giving sixty (60) days written notice to MMI.
perturbation.changed_text:
This Agreement shall be valid for an indefinite period.

Both parties may terminate the Agreement with immediate effect

- -        of either party breaches a material term of the Agreement

- -        in case of a merger or change of key management or control

- -        in case of bankruptcy or similar.

Dragon may not terminate this agreement without Dragon Systems prior written consent.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause provides Dragon Systems with the ability to terminate the agreement without cause by giving sixty days notice. The revised text removes this right, stating that Dragon Systems can only terminate with prior written consent, which introduces a contradiction and affects the conditions for termination.
